title.narrative: Emergency mental health, psychosocial support and physical rehabilitation services for drought affected communities in Herat Province

description.narrative: The project aims to address the emergency needs of Mental Health and Psychosocial support (here after called MHPSS) and Physical Rehabilitation of the drought affected communities in Herat Province (Herat City, Injil and Gozarah district) by: 1) Enhancing the existing health facilities to response to the increased needs 2) Deploying emergency mobile teams that would treat those who cannot access the existing services 3) Establishing referral pathways between the mobile teams, the health structures and/ or other partners providing basic health care or basic needs (wash, nutrition, food, etc.) For this, four gender-balanced technical teams would be working part time in the IDP settlements and part time in the health structures in the following locations: Gozara District: District hospital and IDP settlements Herat City: Regional hospital, Naw Abad Public Health Clinic and IDP settlements Injil District: Kahdestan Public Health Clinic and IDP settlements. The action will be implemented in close coordination with other actors providing basic health services as well as actors providing basic needs in the aforementioned districts. Each team is gender balance (1 female +1 male) and includes 2 psychosocial counsellors, 2 physiotherapists and 1 social worker. The technical teams are supported by the Project Officer and the Data base officer. The action targets drought affected communities in the above mentioned districts, particularly the most vulnerable women, men, girls and boys at risk of exclusion (including people with special needs (PwSN), people with disabilities (PwD), people with injuries, people experimenting psychosocial distress or mental health troubles – due to displacement and conflict), who are often invisible to mainstream relief organizations due to the specificity of their needs. By identifying specific vulnerabilities and providing physical rehabilitation and MHPSS support services to these vulnerable groups the action will reduce their vulnerability and will mitigate the impact of the drought by facilitating access to lifesaving services, improving functional capacities and independence, strengthening positive coping mechanisms, promoting wellbeing, and reducing the chances of psychological distress.
